arts.ttl: There's great spirit in this group - Glasner
arts.sum: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner praises the spirit in his squad after they secured a third consecutive Premier League win with a 1-0 victory against Ipswich.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Crystal Palace 1 Ipswich 0 - Sarr the star man as Eagles’ impressive Premier League form continues
arts.sum: Crystal Palace secured a third straight Premier League win with Ismaila Sarr’s second-half goal settling their home game against struggling Ipswich Town. Crystal Palace: Henderson, Munoz, Lacroix, Guehi, Richards, Mitchell (Chilwell 71), Wharton (Devenny 87), Lerma, Eze (Esse 90+2), Sarr, Nketiah (Kamada 72).

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace star dedicates winning goal to stricken Mateta with scissor-kick celebration
arts.sum: Crystal Palace forward Ismaila Sarr says he scored his side’s winning goal against Ipswich Town for injured teammate Jean Philippe-Mateta. The Eagles struggled to break down the visitor’s stubborn backline at Selhurst Park on Saturday. Ipswich, though, finally relented in the 82nd minute as Sarr skipped past the defence before sending a delightful chip past […] The post Crystal Palace star dedicates winning goal to stricken Mateta with scissor-kick celebration first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace star reveals intriguing goal celebration was Jean-Philippe Mateta tribute
arts.sum: Crystal Palace forward Ismaila Sarr copied Jean-Phillipe Mateta's signature goal celebration after netting the winner against Ipswich, paying homage to the Frenchman after his horror injury against Millwall

arts.ttl: Glasner highlights crucial difference in Palace performance
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner says Crystal Palace’s patience against Ipswich Town was the key factor in them winning the game, having lost by narrow scorelines themselves earlier this season.

arts.ttl: Ipswich boss Kieran McKenna admits late loss at Crystal Palace is ‘sickening’
'Crunch time is just in front of us' - Glasner reflects on Palace's fine form
arts.sum: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says his team need to find the right balance to prepare for 'crunch time' despite winning four games in a row in all competitions for the first time in five years after a hard-fought victory against Ipswich.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace boss on ‘great characters’ after Ismaila Sarr tribute goal celebration to Jean-Philippe Mateta in win over Ipswich
arts.sum: The former Arsenal striker had a glorious chance to open the scoring inside the opening two minutes but his finish was kept out by goalkeeper Alex Palmer. The former Watford man produced a cool finish as the Eagles took their points tally for the last 10 games to 22 – the most in the Premier League over that period along with runaway leaders Liverpool.

arts.ttl: Exclusive: What Crystal Palace are planning now as Man Utd show interest in Jean-Philippe Mateta
arts.sum: TBR Football understands that Crystal Palace are planning to open contract talks with in-demand striker Jean-Philippe Mateta amid interest from Manchester United. Mateta has been...

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 1-0 Ipswich: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Ismaila Sarr steps into Mateta's shoes
arts.sum: Crystal Palace make it four victories on the bounce in all competitions as they eke out a hard-fought 1-0 Premier League triumph over Ipswich Town at Selhurst Park.
